titleStmt.title: Letter from John M. Hay to Samuel L. Clemens : an electronic text

p.bibl: The Mark Twain Papers, The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley (CU-MARK).

body.head: John M. Hay to Samuel L. Clemens 31 March 1884 • Cleveland, Ohio (MS: CU-MARK, UCLC 41952)

div1.p: I wish you would take a leisure hour or two and copy for me a few hundred lines of "Young's Night Thoughts" and an equal amount of Pollok's "Course of Time". Edward Young's The Complaint; or, Night-Thoughts on Life, Death, & Immortality is a nine-part poem that was published serially between 1772 and 1775. Robert Pollok's The Course of Time, consisting of ten books, was published in 1827, the year of his death. Both were written in blank verse and became best sellers in their time. I want my boy to form a taste for serious and elevated poetry and it will add considerable commercial value to the verses to have them in your hand writing.
